question: In a fixed-bias network, the input signal Vi is applied to the ________ of the transistor while the output Vo is off the ________.
In an emitter-follower, the voltage gain is ________.
In an unbypassed emitter-bias configuration ________ replaces re in the hybrid equivalent circuit.
The feedback pair uses a(n) ________ transistor driving a(n) ________ transistor, the two devices acting effectively much like one pnp transistor.
In a hybrid equivalent circuit, ________ is determined to make it easier to find the other parameters.
The input and output signals are ________ for the typical transistor amplifier at frequencies that permit ignoring the effects of the reactive elements.
C: either in phase or 180º out of phase

question: ________ is slightly affected if the condition ro 10RE is not satisfied in the analysis of an emitter-follower configuration.
The dc load line and ac load line both have the same ________ .
The ________ the level of RL, the ________ the level of ac voltage gain.
The coupling capacitor places the load and collector resistors in a ________ arrangement.
In a voltage-divider bias configuration, the voltage-divider equation is used to determine the ________.
The ________ of the input signal is one of the first concerns in the sinusoidal ac analysis of transistor networks.
The ________ model(s) is (are) commonly used in the small-signal ac analysis of transistor networks.
In a voltage-divider bias configuration, there can be a measurable difference in the results for ________ if the condition ro 10RC is not satisfied.
The level of re is determined by ________.
The ________ the source resistance, the ________ the overall gain of an amplifier.
In a common-base configuration, the input and output voltages are ________ and the output and input currents are ________.
A: 180º out of phase, 180º out of phase

question: Ideally, the changes in the load resistor or the source resistor should have ________ effect on all the parameters of the two-port model.
The ac voltage gain of a Darlington connection is about ________.
One junction of an operating transistor is ________ and the other one is ________.
The output voltage and the input voltage are ________ for the common-base configuration.
A common-base configuration has ________ impedance at the input and ________ impedance at the output.
In a common-emitter configuration ________ is the controlling current while ________ is the controlled current.
For the common-emitter and common-base configurations, the magnitude of ________ and ________ is often not included in the model.
An emitter-follower has ________ impedance at the input and ________ impedance at the output.
________ refers to the forward transfer current ratio.
For transistor amplifiers, the no-load voltage gain is ________ the loaded voltage gain.
The peak value of the ac input signal is controlled by the ________ in a transistor network for the frequencies in the low to midrange.
In an emitter-follower, the output voltage is ________ with the input voltage.
________ can be applied to determine the response of the ac equivalent circuit.
The bypass capacitor in a common-emitter configuration ________ the voltage gain.
The loaded voltage gain of an amplifier is ________ the no-load level.
The common-emitter configuration has a ________ level of input impedance with a ________ voltage and current gain.
For a common-base configuration, the input impedance is relatively ________ and the output impedance quite ________.
The output voltage and the input voltage are ________ for the common-emitter configuration.
